Corpus¶

class flexpy.Corpus.Corpus(project_dir, project_name, include_punctuation)¶

A class that contains the lexicon and texts from the FLEx database.

Parameters

  • project_dir (str) – the directory where the FLEx project’s directory is found

  • project_name (str) – the project name (a folder with this name should be inside project_dir)

  • include_punctuation (bool) – whether punctuation tokens should be included

get_lexicon()¶

Returns a flexpy.Lexicon.Lexicon object containing the lexeme entries in this corpus

get_tag_dict()¶

Gets a flexpy.TagDict.TagDict object for this project

get_texts(include_punctuation=None)¶

Gets the texts for this project as a list of flexpy.Text.Text objects

Parameters

include_punctuation – whether the texts should contain punctuation tokens (defaults to self.include_punctuation)

get_tokenized_contents(texts_to_omit=None)¶

Returns a list of the texts, each of which is a list of string tokens.

e.g. [[“hello”, “world”], [“my”, “name”, “is”, “wesley”]]

get_tokenized_contents_flat(texts_to_omit=None)¶

Returns the texts’ contents, treating the whole corpus as a single text.

e.g. [“hello”, “world”, “my”, “name”, “is”, “wesley”]

get_valid_texts()¶

Gets the texts which are valid (e.g. non-empty)

search_lexicon_glosses(regex)¶

Searches the glosses of the corpus’s lexicon by regex

write_texts_to_file(output_dir)¶

Writes each text to a separate .txt file in output_dir
